briefdescription.para: Incoming connection callback. This callback is called when a ssh_bind has a new incoming connection.

parameterdescription.para: Current sshbind session handler
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new SSH server bind.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated ssh_bind session pointer.

memberdef.argsstring: (ssh_bind sshbind, enum ssh_bind_options_e type, const void *value)
memberdef.name: ssh_bind_options_set

parameterdescription.para: The ssh server bind to use.

briefdescription.para: Set the callback for this bind.

parameterdescription.para: The bind to set the callback on.
An already set up ssh_bind_callbacks instance.
A pointer to private data to pass to the callbacks.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Set the session to blocking/nonblocking mode.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh server bind to use.
Zero for nonblocking mode.

briefdescription.para: Recover the file descriptor from the session.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh server bind to get the fd from.

briefdescription.para: Allow the file descriptor to accept new sessions.

briefdescription.para: Accept an incoming ssh connection and initialize the session.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK when a connection is established

briefdescription.para: Accept an incoming ssh connection on the given file descriptor and initialize the session.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK when a connection is established

briefdescription.para: Handles the key exchange and set up encryption.

parameterdescription.para: A connected ssh session

simplesect.para: SSH_OK if the key exchange was successful

briefdescription.para: Initialize the set of key exchange, hostkey, ciphers, MACs, and compression algorithms for the given ssh_session.

detaileddescription.para: The selection of algorithms and keys used are determined by the options that are currently set in the given ssh_session structure. May only be called before the initial key exchange has begun.

parameterdescription.para: The session structure to initialize.
The ssh server bind to free.

briefdescription.para: Set the acceptable authentication methods to be sent to the client.

detaileddescription.para:
session
The server session
auth_methods
The authentication methods we will support, which can be bitwise-or'd.
Supported methods are:

briefdescription.para: Reply with a standard reject message.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function if you don't know what to respond or if you want to reject a request.

parameterdescription.para: The message to use for the reply.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of the authenticated user.

parameterdescription.para: The message to get the username from.

simplesect.para: The username or NULL if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Get the password of the authenticated user.

parameterdescription.para: The message to get the password from.

simplesect.para: The username or NULL if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Get the publickey of the authenticated user.

detaileddescription.para: If you need the key for later user you should duplicate it.

parameterdescription.para: The message to get the public key from.

parameterdescription.para: the current ssh session

a function pointer to a callback taking the current ssh session and received message as parameters. the function returns 0 if the message has been parsed and treated successfully, 1 otherwise (libssh must take care of the response).
void pointer to be passed to callback functions
